Node.definition: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= land in which there is a lack of water or rainfall, ► resulting in lack of vegetation and other desert like conditions; ≈ associated with thirst and hardship
mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy
= bright golden yellow flower, growing with several flowers on one stem; ◄ Narcissus tazetta; ≈ symbol of beauty
mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it
mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
= range of mountains; ◄ north of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) ► known for the cedar (אֶרֶז) and other trees growing there
= state in which deities, humans, or animals have personal greatness and a high status, recognized and respected by others
= mountain; ◄ located in north of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) overlooking the Mediterranean Sea
= plain; ◄ along the coast of the Mediterranean

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which deities, humans, or animals have personal greatness and a high status, recognized and respected by others
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

literally: to strengthen (someone's) hands; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause other humans to be mentally strong able to deal with issues relating to their daily work and to morals and ethics
literally: to strengthen (someone's) hands; hence: = causative action by which human help other humans to find the courage to perform a certain event
= central area of the leg where the thigh is joined to the lower leg; ≈ associated with stability and strength
literally: to stumble; hence: hence: process by which humans go through a time in which they are unable to cope with the circumstances they have to deal with

Node.gloss: to strengthen|to support|to repair|to let grow strong
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause inanimate objects or (other) humans to have physical, political, and/or military strength

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: hastened of heart; hence: = state in which humans experience an emotion of fear and anxiety which does not allow them to find peace of mind
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

Node.gloss: to be strong (mentally)|to be courageous|to stand firm|to be resolute
Node.definition: = state in which humans are mentally strong and able to deal with issues relating to good leadership, morals and ethics, war, and the supernatural world

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger
= action by which humans or deities deal with other humans of deities according to their actions, which could be either by punishing them or by giving them a reward
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts
= referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future
literally: to open (someone else's) eyes; hence: = causative action by which deities give humans the ability to see things that they were not able to see before

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= state in which a person or animal is unable to see
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
= state in which humans or animals are unable to perceive with the ears
literally: to open (someone's) ear; hence: = causative action by which deities allow humans to hear
= referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future
= action by which someone moves forward at a relatively high speed while jumping over any obstacles on the way

= wild animal, standing about a meter high, that ruminates, and of which the male grows antlers, which are dropped every year; has a reddish fur with white spots during summer; during winter the white spots disappear and the coat becomes darker; ◄ belongs to family of cervidae; ► clean animal and can therefore be eaten; ≈ associated with strength, speed, and agility; the male is also associated with sexual prowess
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
= state in which humans or animals are unable to speak ◄ because of a physical limitation or because of emotions
= process by which natural forces find their way by breaking through any obstacles that keep them from moving forward
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season
= land that has been affected by extreme heat
= small body of stagnant water, usually in swampy area; ≈ seen as a blessing when contrasted with the desert, but as a curse when contrasted with a developed area
= state in which land is extremely dry and in need of water, ◄ as if it were thirsty
= a place where water wells up from an underground source

= animal looking like a longhaired dog with a pointed nose; yellowish brown in color with red tips to the fur on the back and a bushy tail; produces mournful sounds; ≈ used mainly in poetry and associated with death, destruction, and devastation, but also with mourning and weeping
= place where animals lie down to rest
= type of grass; ◄ plants; ► serves as food for animals; ≈ regarded as weak, vulnerable, and short lived

= a tall grass with stiff, sharply pointed leaves and a plume like flower head that reaches to more than 2 m; it grows in lakes and streams, the roots creeping across the bottom of the lake to produce new leaves and stalks; or on riverbanks; ◄ Phragmites australis (Common reed) or Arundo donax (Giant reed); ► used for baskets, mats, flutes, pens, arrows, and roof coverings; ≈ symbol of weakness and undependability, but also flexibility

= tall sedge with a smooth triangular stem, and multiple drooping, clustered flower stalks arising from the apex of the main stalk; ◄ |iCyperus papyrus|i*, found in the Nile (יְאֹר) valley; ► used for many different purposes in the Ancient Near East, such as writing material, ships, mattresses, furniture, rope, sandals, etc.
= a relatively wide road or access ramp made by by covering the surface of the ground with thicks layers of sand
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals
literally: to cry out; hence: = action by which humans or deities assign a name to a person, place, object, or phenomenon
= state in which humans have been morally and/or ethically contaminated by evil behavior
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= pertaining to being foolish, which manifests itself in a lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, much talking, and being unable to conceal one's emotions

= the largest of the great cats, often being about 2.8 meters from nose to tip of tail, standing as high as 1 meter (3 feet 3 inches) at the shoulder; pale yellowish brown in color; around the neck and shoulders of adult males grows a mane that is darker than the rest of their fur; ◄ Panthera leo; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with aggression, fearlessness, and respect
possibly shortened form of נֶפֶשׁ חַיָּה living creature: = animal; ◄ generic, sometimes referring to all animals, sometimes limited to wild land animals only
= particle marking a proposition as not true

Node.gloss: to go up|to climb up|to mount
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals or objects go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot, carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
literally: to be found (in a place); hence: = state in which humans or objects are located in a certain place
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

= causative action by which humans or deity deliver an individual or group of people from the power of someone else or from difficult circumstances, ► which usually implies that the one who performed the act of deliverance has the right to claim the ones he delivered for himself
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities
= state in which humans feel and show great joy

literally: to overtake; hence: = process by which events that humans have been expecting or dreading finally take place, ◄ as if they had been pursuing them for some time and ultimately caught up with them
= process by which humans experience sorrow and suffering
= act by which humans make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering
